title: Electric potential - Ex from V-of-x linear graph

content.question: An electric field in a region of space results in an electric potential <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math> that varies with position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> as shown in the graph. Which of the following correctly describes the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component <math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> of the electric field over the range shown in the graph?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is positive and constant.

<math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is positive and increases in magnitude as <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> increases.
<math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is negative and constant.

<math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is negative and increases in magnitude as <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> increases.

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>x</mi></msub></math> is negative and constant.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
